intro: Forsskaolea candida, commonly known as the white sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low water availability. Forsskaolea candida is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
